docs.snippet: I complain, Mayor Lindsay, not that crime in New York has increased but that its quality has deteriorated. And to that I offer the testimony of Thomas Byrnes, famous nineteenth-century head of the New York cops, one of the first to publish photogr...
docs.lead_paragraph: I complain, Mayor Lindsay, not that crime in New York has increased but that its quality has deteriorated. And to that I offer the testimony of Thomas Byrnes, famous nineteenth-century head of the New York cops, one of the first to publish photographs with dossiers -- of what must have been some of his favorite crooks and methods.
docs.abstract: J Finney article contrasting present day crime with that in 19th-century says that latter had much more character; examples cited; illus

headline.main: When Felony Had Style; Crime in the Heyday Of the Pickpockets and Confidence Men

docs.snippet: CERVINIA, Italy, Jan. 31 (UPI) -- Switzerland's No. 2 team made a breakneck second-heat run down the perilous Blue Lake course today and won the 1971 world four-man bobsled championship. Due to cracks in the course, the final competition was held ...
docs.lead_paragraph: CERVINIA, Italy, Jan. 31 (UPI) -- Switzerland's No. 2 team made a breakneck second-heat run down the perilous Blue Lake course today and won the 1971 world four-man bobsled championship. Due to cracks in the course, the final competition was held to two heats.
docs.abstract: world champs, Cervinia, Italy; Switzerland wins 4-man champ

docs.snippet: NEIL Simon's "Last of the Red Hot Lovers" is getting warmed up for the screen. The current Broadway hit has been purchased by Paramount, the company that has sponsored movie adaptations of a string of Simon successes that includes "Come Blow Your ...
docs.lead_paragraph: NEIL Simon's "Last of the Red Hot Lovers" is getting warmed up for the screen. The current Broadway hit has been purchased by Paramount, the company that has sponsored movie adaptations of a string of Simon successes that includes "Come Blow Your Horn," "Barefoot in the Park," "The Odd Couple" and "Plaza Suite," which will be a summer attraction at Radio City Music Hall.
